azureml 0.1.0
  • Reference

Create AmlCompute

Source: R/compute.R
create_aml_compute.Rd

Create AmlCompute

create_aml_compute(workspace, cluster_name, vm_size,
  vm_priority = "dedicated", min_nodes = 0, max_nodes = NULL,
  idle_seconds_before_scaledown = NULL, admin_username = NULL,
  admin_user_password = NULL, admin_user_ssh_key = NULL,
  vnet_resourcegroup_name = NULL, vnet_name = NULL,
  subnet_name = NULL, tags = NULL, description = NULL)

Arguments

workspace

workspace object
cluster_name

cluster name
vm_size

Size of agent VMs. More details can be found here: https://aka.ms/azureml-vm-details. Note that not all sizes are available in all regions, as detailed in the previous link.
vm_priority

dedicated or lowpriority VMs. If not specified, will default to dedicated.
min_nodes

Minimum number of nodes to use on the cluster. If not specified, will default to 0
max_nodes

Maximum number of nodes to use on the cluster
idle_seconds_before_scaledown

Node idle time in seconds before scaling down the cluster
admin_username

Name of the administrator user account which can be used to SSH into nodes
admin_user_password

Password of the administrator user account
admin_user_ssh_key

SSH public key of the administrator user account
vnet_resourcegroup_name

Name of the resource group where the virtual network is located
vnet_name

Name of the virtual network
subnet_name

Name of the subnet inside the vnet
tags

A dictionary of key value tags to provide to the compute object
description

A description to provide to the compute object

Contents

  • Arguments
